noun.description: Botany. The condition of being polysymmetrical.
Crystallography. The property of a mineral of exhibiting characteristics of two different symmetries.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Alfred Bennett (1833–1902), botanist and publisher. From poly- + symmetry, after German Polysymmetrie (J. Sachs Lehrb. der Bot (ed. 3, 1873) III. iii. 90, in sense 1; P. Groth Einleitung in die chem. Krystallogr 4, in sense 2).
